{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3138362,"name":"","username":"manso","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/e99b99/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-02T16:54:10.779Z","cooked":"

CTRE’s Falcon500 has an integrated motor controller a “TalonFX”, apparently the TalonFX has an integrated sensor, however I can’t find any documentation on the programming side of things.

I know it’s possible to view the sensor data through Pheonix Tuner, but I don’t know how to ‘see’ the data in a programmable way.

(i.e if the sensor has passed x amount of rotations do y action)

I would look at the Example for Integrated Sensor

github.com

Phoenix-Examples-Languages/Java Talon FX (Falcon 500)/IntegratedSensor at master...

master/Java%20Talon%20FX%20(Falcon%20500)/IntegratedSensor

HERO C#, FRC C++/Java, future platforms. Contribute to CrossTheRoadElec/Phoenix-Examples-Languages development by creating an account on GitHub.

We also have documentation on how to use Tuner to view the sensor data and make sure everything is correct before moving on to the programming.

v5.docs.ctr-electronics.com

Bring Up: Talon FX/SRX Sensors

This section is dedicated to validating any rotary sensor attached to the Talon SRX and the integrated sensor on the Talon FX. Generally attaching a sensor is necessary for: Close-Loop control mode...

Crosby Jr","username":"NewtonCrosbyJr","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/newtoncrosbyjr/{size}/163897_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-02T18:20:05.000Z","cooked":"

As lame of an awnser as it is, I genuinely reccomend looking at CTRE’s docs. It does a great job explaining how to get your falcons properly configured in code, as well as getting all the different sorts of data you can call for.

Once your falcons are comletely ready to go, the way you’d get the sensor’s position in wpilib is [insert talonFX object here].getSelectedSensorPosition();
which will return a value in encoder ticks
